info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 4:03PM EDT until June 22 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LOUDOUN COUNTY IN NORTHERN VIRGINIA...EAST CENTRAL FREDERICK AND CENTRAL CLARKE COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN VIRGINIA... JEFFERSON AND SOUTHEASTERN BERKELEY COUNTIES IN THE PANHANDLE OF WEST VIRGINIA... At 402 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Martinsburg to near Purcellville, moving southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Martinsburg, Charles Town, Purcellville, Ranson, Berryville, Inwood, Round Hill, Kearneysville, Corporation Of Ranson, Bluemont, Bolivar, Shenandoah Junction, Middleway, Hillsboro, Gaylord, Clear Brook, Ridgeway, Bunker Hill, Stephenson and Millville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
